solution.text:
Let the number of mangoes younger brother have be x
Then, elder brother will have x - _{j}_ mangoes.
Therefore,
\(Product = x\times (x-_{j}_)\)
i.e., \(_{{2*j*j}}_ = x\times (x-_{j}_)\)
i.e., \(_{{2*j*j}}_ = x^2 - _{j}_x\)
i.e., \(x^2 - _{j}_x -_{{2*j*j}}_ = 0 \)
i.e., Comparing with \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\)
We get, a = 1, b = -_{j}_ and c = -_{{2*j*j}}_
Now, Check the discriminant
i.e., \(b^2 - 4ac = (-_{j}_)^2 - 4\times 1\times (-_{{2*j*j}}_)\)
i.e., = _{{j*j}}_ + _{{8*j*j}}_
i.e., = _{{9*j*j}}_
Since \((b^2 - 4ac)\ge 0\)
Therefore, it is possible to distribute mangoes among the brothers.
Now solving the obtained equation to find the value of x.
x = \(_{j}_\pm \sqrt{_{{9*j*j}}_}\over 2\)
x = \(_{j}_\pm _{{3*j}}_\over 2\)
x = \(_{j}_ + _{{3*j}}_\over 2\) and x = \(_{j}_ - _{{3*j}}_\over 2\)
x = \(_{{4*j}}_\over 2\) and x = \(-_{{2*j}}_\over 2\)
x = _{{2*j}}_ and x = -_{{1*j}}_
Since x is number of mangoes, it can not be negative.
Thus, younger brother will get _{{2*j}}_ mangoes.

content.text: Is it possible to distribute certain number of mangoes among two brothers, such that elder brother gets _{j}_ mangoes less than his younger brother. Also the product of the numbers of mangoes they will get is _{{2*j*j}}_.If yes, find how many mangoes will the younger brother get.
